accessibility.text: image34.jpg
What are the reactions?
image34.jpg
What are the reactions?

…all possible levels of excitation are described in birds, from outwardly non-visible physiological reactions to protection, ducking, increased calling activity, restless pacing back and forth, running away, flying off and returning to the same place or a place close by, flying off and leaving the area, right through to panic- like flight reactions.
Birds often react to the appearance of airplanes with a marked increase in heart rate, in other words they become nervous, even if no outward reaction is visible.
image34.jpg

One case of bear and cubs fleeing to 				another territory
